WRITING.TEXT: Start with the [videos on Hacker101](https://www.hacker101.com/videos) and work through their CTFs. Most, if not all, can be done with the community version of Burp, which is free.
Performance is fantastic. First time playing a -vania style Metroidvania, and it's utterly amazing.
Seeing the smooth 60fps on other plastforms has me a little jealous, but it's great being able to play portably.
There are slight dips here and there, mostly when loading a new area. Nothing during critical moments.
Stuck at 720p docked, i assume the same in handheld
No patch for the switch version yet
Some displays can output the resolution; the FPS difference is obvious once you've seen both

WRITING.TITLE: Baldur's Gate is here! Overwhelmingly large and well-written

WRITING.TEXT: Font size is adjustable. This and the zoomability in the enhanced edition makes it totally playable.

It runs great, but feels like an old-school CRPG. UI can feel a little clunky at times, and the paused-base combat takes some getting used to, but it's really fun once you get into it. It's also a direct translation of D amp;D rules, so combat/weapon/armor stats are all based on dice rolls rather than arbitrary numbers/number ranges. It's a fairly complex system, but it's refreshing to see exactly what is going into damage calculations.
